Plotting hystar objects

Source: vignettes/hystar_plot.Rmd
hystar_plot.Rmd

Plot method of the hystar_fit and hystar_sim class

Plots the time series of the control variable z and the outcome variable y on top of each other, with background colors indicating the regimes. Simply call the plot() argument on an object of class hystar_fit or hystar_sim.

Example 

simulated_hystar <- hystar_sim(z = z_sim())
plot(simulated_hystar)

Parameters

You can specify the following additional parameters (with defaults):

Names:

  • name_regime0 = "Regime 0"

  • name_regime1 = "Regime 1"

  • name_regime_unknown = "Unknown"

  • zlab = "z", label of the y-axis in the z-plot

  • ylab = "y", label of the y-axis in the y-plot

  • xlab = "x", label of the x-axis

Colors:

  • color_regime0 = "white"

  • color_regime0 = "grey85"

  • color_regime_unknown = "AA001137"

  • color_z = "grey25"

  • color_y = "grey25"

Lines:

  • line_type_z = 1

  • line_width_z = 2.5

  • line_type_y = 1

  • line_width_y = 2.5

Other:

  • show_legend = TRUE
